page.title: 17SCHOOL IN SHEFFIELD
page.content: Our school,{Firshill Middle School,}is in an area of Sheffield called {Pitsmoor.}It was opened in 1893 and is an old board school. There is also a first school which opened in 1906. It has a nursery unit. During 1984/5 there were 12 teachers and about 200 children but in 1986 there will only be 10 teachers. There is also a head teacher, a school clerk, general assistant and a school caretaker. In Firshill Middle School the children are aged 8-12. There are 9 classes, two for each year except M3's who are in 3 classes. 8 classes are in the main building. Our class is in a terrapin (mobile classroom) in the middle of the yard. Boys and girls now share playgrounds which used to be used separately.
